overview.ovdesc:
AM.VALUATION.EXT.GRP.CONS.LW will store the consolidated positions for various Groups defined in AM.GROUP.PORT application, for the last working day. This is a copy of the AM.VALUATION.EXT.GRP.CONS taken during batch.
The following is the criteria for consolidating the various positions for each portfolio and populate the AM.VALUATION.EXTRACT.GROUP.CONS.
CASH
Distinct currencies are consolidated separately
Money Market
Distinct currencies are consolidated separately
Distinct maturities are consolidated separately
Fiduciary
Notice and fixed fiduciaries are consolidated separately
Distinct rates are consolidated separately
Distinct currencies are consolidated separately
Distinct maturities are consolidated separately
FOREX
Distinct maturities are consolidated separately
Distinct Couple currencies are consolidated separately
REPO
Distinct currencies are consolidated separately
Distinct security codes are consolidated separately

AlphaNumeric Id which identifies the identifies the AM.VALUATION.EXT.GRP.CONS.LW.
Each AM.VALUATION.EXT.GRP.CONS record is identified by the following components separated by a "*":
1) Group ID
This is a 3-10 alphanumeric Group Id identifying the group.
2) Application system id
This is a 2 Alphanumeric Product id.
Positions 3 to 7 will be filled based on the Application System Id.
3) Security Code
This is used for Security Positions and Repos.
4) Security Currency
This is used for Cash, Money Market, Fiduciary, Forex and Repo.
5) Maturity date
This is used for Money market, Fiduciary and Forex.
6) Interest Rate
This is used for Fiduciary.
7) Transaction type
This is used for Fiduciary(NOTICE or FIXED) and Securities(Bond or Share).
8) Sub Asset type
9) Asset type
10) Position Type
This is based on the requirement whether the positive and negative posiitons should be consolidation seperately or combined for different products. The following values are possible :
P - Consolidated Positive Positions
N - Consolidated Negative positions
C - Consolidated Positive and Negative Positions together.
No Input field
Automatically updated by the system whenever the Group Consolidation was performed

t.desc:
The contents of this field varies depending on the module that the position is for.
If the position is for an Account (AC) then this field will contain the consolidated ONLINE.ACTUAL.BAL balances from the Account records plus the value of any forward entries for those accounts generated by the Securities module for transactions that have updated the portfolio.
If the position is for a Fiduciary Contract (FD) then this field will contain the consolidated principal amounts from the AMOUNT field on the underlying FD.FID.ORDER records for this group.
If the position is for a FOREX contract the this field will Contain the consolidated amount bought (AMOUNT.BOUGHT) expressed in the currency CURRENCY.BOUGHT field from the original FOREX records .
If the position is for a Money Market (MM) contract then this field will contain the consolidated principal amount from the PRINCIPAL field on the MM.MONEY.MARKET record that gave rise to the position. If the position is for a loan then the amount will have a negative '-' symbol before it.
If the position is for a security position (SC) then this field will contain the consolidated number of securities held by the Group. If the security position is short then the figure will be preceded by a '-' sign.
Validation Rules:
No input field
Automatically updated by the system during batch process when the Group Consolidation is performed

desc.p: If the position is a Money Market (MM) or a Fiduciary (FD) contract then this field represents theconsolidated annual income - i.e. contract amount multiplied by the interest rate.

If the position is a Securities (SC) position then this field will represent an consolidated estimated annual income from the Interest Rate of the Security if it is a Bond or the PRICE.EARN.RATIO field on the SECURITY.SUPP record for the security if it is a share.
This field is not updated if the position is for an account (AC), a Forex (FX) contract.
No input field
Automatically updated by the system during batch when the Group consolidation is performed.

This field contains the value of the asset in the currency contained in the associated GRP.VAL.CURRENCY field.

If the position is for an Account (AC) then this field will contain the consolidated ONLINE.ACTUAL.BAL balance from the Account records plus the value of any forward entries for this account generate by the Securities module for transactions that have updated the portfolio.
If the position is for a Fiduciary Contract (FD) then this field will contain the consolidated principal amount from the AMOUNT field on the underlying FD.FID.ORDER record.
If the position is for a Forex contract (FX) then this field will contain the consolidated Estimated profit or loss of the Forex transaction.
If the position is for a Money Market (MM) contract then this field will contain the consolidated principal amount from the PRINCIPAL field on the MM.MONEY.MARKET records that represent this Group.

If the position is for a Security positin then this field will contain an consolidated estimated value of the security position calculated using the market price in the associated MARKET.PRICE field. If the security position is short then the figure will be preceded by a '-' sign.
No input field
Automatically updated by the System during batch processing when the Group Consolidation was performed

This field contains the value of the asset in the currency ontained in the associated GRP.VAL.CURRENCY field.
If the position is for an Account (AC) then this field will contain the consolidated ONLINE.ACTUAL.BAL balance from the Account records for the group.
If the position is for a Fiduciary Contract (FD) then this field will contain the consolidated principal amount from the AMOUNT field on the underlying FD.FID.ORDER records for the group.
If the position is for a Forex contract (FX) then this field will contain the estimated profit or loss of the Forex transactions that constitute this group.

If the position is for a Money Market (MM) contract then this field will contain the consolidated principal amount from the PRINCIPAL field on the MM.MONEY.MARKET records of different positions that belong to this group.

If the position is for a Security positin then this field will contain an consolidated estimated value of the security position calculated using the market price in the associated MARKET.PRICE field. If the security position is short then the figure will be preceded by a '-' sign. This figure will only include securities that have updated the security position via transactions that have settled before the next working day.
No input field
Automatically updated by the system during batch processing when the Group consolidation is performed

This field contains the Consolidated amount of interest (income) that has been accrued for the Group but not yet been capitalised.
If the position is for an account (AC) then this field will contain the sum of the ACCR.CR.AMOUNT, ACCR.CR2.AMOUNT, ACCR.DR.AMOUNT and ACCR.DR2.AMOUNT fields of all Account records for the group.

If the position is for a Money Market (MM) contract then if the contract is a deposit then this field will contain the consolidated amount from the OUTS.CUR.ACC.I.PAY from the LMM.ACCOUNT.BALANCES records that represent this group. If the contract is a loan then this field will contain the OUTS.ACCRUED.INT field from the LMM.ACCOUNT.BALANCES records for the Group.
If the position represents a Fiduciary contract (FD) then this field will be updated from the OTS.INTEREST field on the FD.BALANCES record for all the contracts that constitute this Group.
If the position represents a FOREX (FX) contract or a Forward Rate Agreement then this field will contain 0.
If this position is for a Security then this field represents the consolidated amount of accrued interest for the Group.
No input field
Automatically updated by the system during batch processing when the Group Consolidation is performed
